fields.description:
h3.Summary
If you choose Add Personal Space, cancel, and then choose it again, a different screen is shown. There doesn't appear to be any broken functionality, but it can be confusing to users that the same action shows you two different screens. Screenshots are attached.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Click the User icon in the upper right corner
# Choose Add Personal Space
# Click Close
# Repeat steps 1 and 2 and observe that the screen shown is different than the first time
# Click cancel and repeat steps 1 and 2 and see that you are shown the same screen as the first time
fields.summary: Two versions of Add Personal Space screen are shown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67379].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
Carriage Returns (ASCII 0011 or Shift+Enter in Word) is ignored and do not get imported correctly into Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download this sample .docx file  [^Carriage return.docx] 
 !CONFSERVER-41626-docx view.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a Confluence page. Save the page
# Go to Page tools (3 dots on top right) > Import Word Document
# Choose the word doc downloaded on Step 1 > Click Next > Choose Import

h3. Expected Results
The page should look exactly like the Word file

h3. Actual Results
The Carriage returns are ignored. The content is combined into a single line instead.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added
fields.summary: Carriage returns do not import correctly from Word

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41625].
  {panel}

Within a given project the colors of a pie chart change their meaning, particularly if a pie chart reports out status based information. I have a status board showing pie charts of various aspects of a broad effort. Filtering on the total effort, or one of the two aspects results in three separate pie charts where the colors map to different statuses! This makes the pages significantly less easy to interpret. 

The current implementation appears to assign colors based upon the magnitude of various aspects of the project, which might be fine for filtering on other things, but on status it makes multiple pie charts on the same page difficult. A fix for this would be to assign colors based upon the order the statuses are enumerated... in such a way the statuses wouldn't change from one chart to the next, and you could again interpret the charts as "too much blue" or "all green means everything is closed", etc.

Some examples follow.

*Total work effort:*
!image-2016-05-06-08-02-18-756.png|thumbnail! 

*One of the two aspects:*
 !image-2016-05-06-08-03-24-197.png|thumbnail! 

*The other aspect:*
 !image-2016-05-06-08-03-48-096.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Chart (Pie Chart) Colors Change Meaning

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a Connector directory with read-write permissions to LDAP, a new user added to LDAP can login to Confluence even if the directory is not synchronized.

Our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/synchronising-data-from-external-directories-229838498.html] states :
{quote}
Note that a user will not be able to log in until the synchronisation task has copied that user's details into the cache.
{quote}

However, new users from ldap are able to login even if the Directory is not synchronoized and behave very similar to the delegated directory.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.1 , 5.9.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Create a new LDAP directory connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory] with read-write permissions in Confluence.  
# In LDAP create a new user
# Login to Confluence with this new user

h3. Expected Results
The user should not be able to login as the directory is not synchronized after the new user was added.

h3. Actual Results
The user can login.
fields.summary: New user able to login even when the Connector directory is not synchronized.

fields.description:
Adding video attachments to pages automatically inserts a multimedia macro, as shown in the first attached screenshot. This is expected.

This macro claims to support AVI, MOV and MP4 playback.

However, I am consistently seeing only MP4 support, with "This plugin is not supported" errors given in Chrome, FF and IE. This is not expected.

I produced my test videos using Camtasia Studio, from the same source recording. My colleagues who are also experiencing this have produced their AVI videos using a different process. We are all seeing the same thing.

Chrome is our internally supported browser of choice, and I am as up-to-date as I can be on Version 51.0.2704.29 beta-m (64-bit).
fields.summary: Video playback is limited to MP4 only in 5.9.7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41622].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Many attachment-*.tmp files remain in <confluence_install>/temp after uploading attachment files to a Page with REST API.

Thousands of attachment-*.tmp files remain in <confluence_install>/temp directory.
 Sometimes amount of total file sizes become several GB.
 those files are not deleted by scheduled job, since the job deletes files in <confluence_home>/temp.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.9.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. curl -v -S -u admin:password -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -F "file=@myfile.txt" -F "comment=this is my file" "http://localhost:8090/rest/api/content/<page id>/child/attachment" | python -mjson.tool
 2. check <confluence_install>/temp directory.
h3. Expected Results

Temporary files should be deleted after completing the REST API.
 or 
 A scheduled job deletes them.
h3. Actual Results

Temporary files remain after competing REST API program.
 And when Confluence is stopped, those tmp files are deleted.
 This means those files maybe remain in temp directory for long term.
h3. Workaround

Remove the files from <confluence_install>/temp manually, or implemente a cronjob in the operating system to cleanup the folder.
fields.summary: Clean up attachment-*.tmp files in <confluence_install>/temp directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41619].
  {panel}

The Image Gallery macro provides various parameters for including/excluding images based on image name and labels. Display of the images does honour these parameters, except when clicking on the images and scrolling through. Then other attachments to the page are also displayed.

E.g. A page with attachments application.png, desktop.png, paddock.png, meadow.png & processes.pdf. Files paddock.png & meadow.png have label 'gallery'. Using various combinations of parameters *Images to Exclude*, *Include these Images Only*, *Exclude Images with these Labels* & *Include Images with these Labels Only* will display the correct images on the page.
However if one of the images is clicked the images are displayed in the attachment preview, and the user can then scroll through *ALL* attachments to the page.

It would be better if the images displayed are limited to those specified in the Image Gallery macro.
fields.summary: Image Gallery Macro should includeexclude images when viewing in preview

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* After a thorough investigation and analysis of the issue by Development and Support teams, we found that this TDM Merge issue did not have as high of an impact to memory as previously assessed. Our attempts at reproducing an OutOfMemoryError (OOME) or stability problem have been unsuccessful. Both the support and development teams have done a thorough investigation around the linked support cases; and the conclusion is that TDM code is not to blame. The stack trace in the logs is merely just a warning which indicates that the infinite loop has been detected and hence terminated.

We are closing this issue as Cannot Reproduce. If you are still experiencing the symptoms that relate to this bug please contact support by following the links at [https://support.atlassian.com/confluence/] so we can help identify the root cause of your issue.

This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41610].
{panel}
Regression of CONFSERVER-32164
h4. Problem summary

When Collaborative editing is disabled, or in a version of Confluence below 6.0, under specific conditions, Confluence can run out of memory when a user goes to edit a Confluence page or view his drafts (Username > Drafts), following a sequence of events:
 # User A goes edit a page (Version 1)
 # Confluence auto-saves a draft based on Version 1, and user does not save the page
 # User B edits the same page and saves, promoting the page to Version 2
 # User A views his drafts (or edits the page again)
 # Confluence tries to merge the three versions (Version 1, Version 1 draft, and Version 2), and results in Confluence hanging

Stack trace:
{noformat}
2016-04-28 12:13:09,528 WARN [com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger:thread-311] [confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger] mergeContentInternal Merge failed.
 -- url: /confluence/pages/editpage.action | referer: https://XXXX/confluence/display/SPACE/PAGE | userName: user | page: 1052053228 | action: editpage
java.lang.RuntimeException: ASSERTION FAILED: Merge.treeMerge(). Infinitive recursive loop.
        at tdm.lib.Merge.treeMerge(Merge.java:107)
        at tdm.lib.Merge.treeMerge(Merge.java:173)
        at tdm.lib.Merge.treeMerge(Merge.java:173)
        at tdm.lib.Merge.treeMerge(Merge.java:173)
        at tdm.lib.Merge.treeMerge(Merge.java:173)
        at tdm.lib.Merge.merge(Merge.java:82)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger.mergeContentInternal(TDMMerger.java:99)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger.access$000(TDMMerger.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger$1.call(TDMMerger.java:120)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger$1.call(TDMMerger.java:116)
        at com.atlassian.sal.core.executor.ThreadLocalDelegateCallable.call(ThreadLocalDelegateCallable.java:42)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
Details:
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32164?focusedCommentId=854595&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-854595
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32164?focusedCommentId=904073&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-904073

h4. Workaround

*6.0 and later*

Make sure that Collaborative Editing is enabled and working, as the affected merge code is not used unless it is disabled.

*Warning:*
The below workarounds involve deleting one or more drafts. Drafts contain edits that have not yet been saved, so important work can be lost by deleting them.

*5.5 and later*
If a user has been identified causing this problem, they can go to {{/users/viewmydrafts.action}} page and discard either all of their drafts or just the draft for the page that is known to trigger this problem.

*All versions*
Alternatively, all the drafts can be deleted directly from the DB:
 # Back up Confluence DB as a precaution
 # Run the following DELETE statements against the DB:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT');
DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT';
{code}

 # Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics > Flush all (down at the bottom)
fields.summary: TDM merger fails due to infinite recursive loop

fields.description:
I've found an issue that may be a bug, but may be the way Confluence works. If this is the case, then it's very odd behaviour to have as standard. (smile)

I'm trying to hide a page from the tree, so I've made it an orphan page. 
If you open the top page of a space, which the tree is at its most minimal, then the orphaned page isn't visible.

However, if I click on a link in the tree that I have clicked on before, the orphaned page is now visible. (I can see the difference between a previously selected and non-selected link because they're different shades of blue.)

If I return to the top page, and then click on a link in the tree that I haven't clicked on before (ever...) the orphaned page isn't visible.

But (with the orphaned page now visible in the tree), if I click on a previously clicked link or one that hasn't been clicked before, the orphaned page remains visible.

I've checked and re-checked this, so I'm sure this is a reproduce-able problem.
We're running 5.9.9 server.
fields.summary: Orphaned pages not hidden in tree

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Scrolling through the list of pages to export to PDF when choosing Custom Export, is observed to be slower when using Firefox in compare to using Google Chrome.

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer
* Firefox
* Confluence 5.8.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Mozilla Firefox
# Have a space that contains a large number of child pages (tested with 4000 child pages)
# Go to Space Tools > Content Tools > Export > PDF 
# Choose "Custom Export"
# Wait until all the pages trees are being loaded
 !image-2016-05-03-18-26-37-796.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The following actions:
# Scrolling through the list of pages and
# Checking and unchecking pages 

Should not take so much time

h3. Actual Results
The following actions:
# Scrolling through the list of pages and
# Checking and unchecking pages 

Takes a noticably some amount of time

h3. Notes
# This issue does not observed in Chrome
# There is negligible difference when using Chrome vs in Mozilla in Confluence latest version, 5.9.7

h3.Workaround
Use Google Chrome
fields.summary: Slow performance while scrolling through the "Choose pages to export" in Exporting PDF in a large space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Invoking username api parameter as [suggested in documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#user-getUser] results in a 404 null uri error, even when users exist.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable REST API
# Query for username, ex: {{http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/api/user?username=admin}}

h3. Expected Results
API returns user information

h3. Actual Results
The below error is thrown in the http response:
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Cache-Control: no-transform
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/xml
Content-Length: 194
Date: Mon, 02 May 2016 22:53:22 GMT

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><status><status-code>404</status-code><message>null for uri: http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/api/user?username=admin</message></status>
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Tested using curl:
{noformat}
$ curl -i http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/api/user?username=admin
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Cache-Control: no-transform
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/xml
Content-Length: 196
Date: Mon, 02 May 2016 23:00:36 GMT

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><status><status-code>404</status-code><message>null for uri: http://localhost:1990/confluence/rest/api/user?username=admin</message></status>
{noformat}

The [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#user-getUser] says that this URL format is correct:
{noformat}
http://example.com/rest/api/user?username=jblogs
http://example.com/rest/api/user?key=402880824ff933a4014ff9345d7c0002
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Unknown at this time
fields.summary: Confluence REST API username parameter returns 404

Hi there,

it would be great, if confluence tasks would offer a way to add a priority.

Maybe via the status-Macro or simply writing PRIO A  or someting. This priority field should then be shown in tasks reports as an own column to be sorted or filtered at (e.g. via table filter addon).

I know, that due date is some kind of priority, but differentiation would be very useful!

h3. Summary
After adding context path, some of the image icons will break because they are still pointing to the old URL

h3. Steps to Replicate 
# Download and install [Confluence O6.0.0-OD-2016.12.4-1123|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-od/]
# [Configure a Context path|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-change-the-confluence-context-path-707985922.html] {{/confluence}}  for the Confluence
# Go to {{Space Tools >> Permission}}

h3. Expected Result
All the icons are displayed correctly
!step1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Actual Result
All the icons are missing
 !wrong context.png|thumbnail! 

If we inspect the icon, the context path is missing from the URL :
* ICON URL that does not have context path - {{<HOSTNAME>/s/en_GB/6437/b27ad99d003a624e726f95c32335af2b8b3b5548/_/images/icons/emoticons/check.png}}. This does not work
* ICON URL that have context path - {{<HOSTNAME>/confluence/s/en_GB/6437/b27ad99d003a624e726f95c32335af2b8b3b5548/_/images/icons/emoticons/check.png}}. This URL works
fields.summary: Confluence icons breaks after Context Path is added

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41557].
  {panel}

h5. Suggestion

Optionally use Bitbucket and/or Bitbucket Server to store attachments for Confluence. This would be especially beneficial for large files, with Git LFS that was recently introduced.

Through branch permissions and application links, permissions could be managed as well and many of the problems that currently exist in attachment handling in Confluence would be solved by this.

File versioning would also be solved by the basic concepts of SCM.
h5. Possible implementation

There could be a Bitbucket project per Confluence instance, creating a repository for each space. Branch permissions could be used to maintain permissions outside of Confluence as well, but alternatively the project/repository could be limited to the integration only.
fields.summary: Use Bitbucket server for optional attachment storage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41551].
  {panel}

*The problem:* If you request the content body using the content rest API, and the content contains macros, the macros don't work (in most cases).

*The cause:*
1 - Some macros don't explicitly list their web resource dependencies, and so the web resource is not included in the response from the API.
2 - Web resources that are included in the superbatch are excluded from API response, so if the super batch doesn't exist on the page, then javascript errors are thrown due to missing dependencies.
3 - Some macros assume a page load lifecycle that will have a load/ready event. When using the rest API this is often not the case.
fields.summary: Cannot render macros from content rest API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41550].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Per [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-skip-the-welcome-action-in-confluence-for-new-users-777016501.html], Confluence Server administrators can disable the add-on that manages the Welcome page for new users in Confluence. The page will be displayed to users until the new users watch a space.

However, in Confluence Cloud disabling system add-ons is a restricted function, and thus administrators in Cloud cannot skip the welcome screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
 Provide functionality in Confluence General Configuration to turn off the welcome screen.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to disable the “welcome.action” screen in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
In short, 
a) linking to a Confluence attachment 
b) from within a Microsoft Word document 
c) when the user is already logged in
d) is redirecting to the Landing Page.

This doesn't happen if the user needs to login (so the login redirect is working correctly).

These Confluence issues seem related, but are not an exact match:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35884
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30930
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29144


At the moment, the user that tripped over this has worked around the problem by
making the Word document into a PDF document - links to attachments in Confluence seem to work when you are linking from a PDF (instead of a Word doc). But it's not an ideal solution, as making word into PDF isnt always possible, so we'd love to come up with something that works better.
fields.summary: Links in Word to documents in Confluence only work if you are not already logged in

h3. Summary

[^test3.pptx] are two identical slides with different extension [^test.ppt]. (Content was removed because it contains company's info)

{code:java}
Caused by: class com.aspose.slides.p6a2feef8.pbdb106a0.cw: Unknown char: c

{code}
{code:java}
Caused by: class com.aspose.slides.p6a2feef8.pbdb106a0.do: Version of TrueType font is incorrect: 2600468736, expected 65536 for v1.0

{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41537].
  {panel}

Hi team,

Need your help in resolving the following bug asap. Any help would be much appreciated.

*Issue:* I have a couple of epics and some stories associated with each of them in JIRA. When I created a wiki page in Confluence, I inserted some issues from JIRA using "JIRA Issue/Filter" built-in macro to display all the Epics and their respective stories in a table. 
While all the other attributes appear correctly +I am not able to get to display, the names of the Epics in the table+. I have included +Epic Name+ and +Epic Link+ both the columns, but Epic Name column in the table is empty, while Epic Link just populates the JIRA Id of the Epic in question.

*Ultimately, I need to display Epic Names in the table and not their ids.* Please suggest how this could be fixed.

+*Also, for your reference, please find the screen shot attached with the ticket*+

h3.Update

This issue seems to also affect other fields like Version. When user generates a report; instead of showing the version number; it shows the version ID instead.

For example. 

{code}
jira=> select * from projectversion where id = 17718;
  id   | project | vname | description | sequence | released | archived | url | releasedate | startdate 
-------+---------+-------+-------------+----------+----------+----------+-----+-------------+-----------
 17718 |   11200 | 1.9   |             |       10 |          |          |     |             | 
(1 row)
{code}

When a report is generated; instead of showing version 1.9 for an issue in a report; it shows 17718 instead.
fields.summary: Epic Names and Version using JIRA Issue/Filter macro (in Confluence), cannot be displayed

fields.description:
I'm migrating pages from another Wiki server to Confluence and as part of this I'm maintaining page links.

I'm currently using the webui link of each page in anchor tags eg.

{code}
"webui": "/display/~andrew.clark/Sprint+7",
{code}

However, if you at some point in the future rename the target page these links are not updated accordingly. This seems to be because the REST api is always treating URLs as external URLs instead of internal links.

Does the REST api support internal links at the moment? If so, what is the URL format required? Otherwise, URLs that match a certain format as provided by the webui field of the content _*should*_ be treated as internal links and act accordingly.
fields.summary: Page links are not treated as internal page links where appropriate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41533].
  {panel}

Hi,

the styling of Sign-Up button in invitation mails can be rendered correctly by Lotus Notes (in our case 9.0.1). The blue part is not rendered and due to the font colour being white, it's not visible in the email.

You can generate this problem by either sending an invitation to an Lotus Notes user or a password reset request.

I understand, that Lotus Notes is not officially supported by Atlassian, however as a administrator, I do not necessarily have the control over my clients email applications, i.e. I do not know what they use or it's not my decision. Basically, if I send out invitations, I do not know if the email is readable or not.

One easy solution to this could be to just send an link without any style applied. Could be implemented as an option for customers who face this problem.
fields.summary: Customize invitation Email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41532].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting a page as PDF, the content of attachments using the {{view-file}} macro (e.g.PDF, PowerPoint) are not rendered. Also, attachments are not included in the PDF export, not in the place they were inserted, nor at the end as an appendix.

This is the page in Confluence
!ConfluencePage_CONF_41532.png|thumbnail!

This is the exported PDF page. Note the attachment is displayed with the paperclip attachment image.
 [^TIC-CONF-41532-300816-1108-2.pdf] 

h3. Suggested Solution
Attachments are rendered inline with the option of including them at the end as a print out.

h3. Workaround
There is no work around.
fields.summary: Include Attachments when exporting a page to PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41529].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
[Enabling absolute date/time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html] in JIRA does not display absolute date/time for issues in a JIRA issue macro. The JIRA issue macro seems to use the syntax of the {{Date Format}} field, rather than the {{Date Time Format}} field, in Formatting and International Settings. 

This would be particularly useful when tracking sprints in Confluence. Attached are two screenshots showing the difference between the date/time display in JIRA and Confluence (in the JIRA issue macro).

h3. Also applies to:
Filter Results macro in Confluence 
Filter Results gadget in JIRA

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to enable absolute date/time in Confluence. 
 

h3. Workaround
Set the {{Date Format}} in *Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Formatting and International Settings* to include time (matching the {{Date Time Format}}): 
{{MMM dd, yyyy HH:mm}}
fields.summary: Absolute date/time not available in JIRA issue macro
Mobile menu does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an environment is running JIRA Macros 5.6.17 and an upgrade compatibility check is performed against Confluence 5.9 and higher, the Confluence update check will list JIRA Macros as incompatible.

 !jiramacros_incompatible.png|thumbnail! 

Confluence update check displayed compatbility issues with:
||Confluence version||JIRA Macros version||Compatability check||
| 5.5.4|5.6.17|5.9 +|
|5.8.15|5.6.17|5.9+|

Confluence udpate check *did not* display compatibility issues with:
||Confluence version||JIRA Macros version||Compatability check||
|5.5.4|5.5.4|5.9+|
|5.8.15|5.6.12|5.9+|
|5.8.15|5.6.17|5.8|

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have JIRA Macros 5.6.17 installed (upgrade as necessary)
# Go to *General Configuration* > *Manage add-ons* > click *Confluence update check*
# Set _Check compatability update_ to any version of Confluence 5.9
# Select *Check*

h3. Expected Results
Should not list JIRA Macros under the *Incompatibility* section

h3. Actual Results
Lists JIRA Macros as Incompatible
 
h3. Notes
Issue does not occur with JIRA Macros 5.6.12 or JIRA Macros 5.5.4, does not occur when checking against versions of Confluence below 5.9, even if running JIRA Macros 5.6.17

h3.Workaround
This can be ignored as Confluence 5.9.x is compatible with JIRA Macros 5.6.17. Upgrading should not cause problems with the JIRA issues Macro.
fields.summary: Plugin compatibility checker shows JIRA Macros 5.6.17 in not compatible with Confluence 5.9+
JIRA Report - Change Log template for multiple versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Tables created in older versions of Confluence include rowspan tags for tables, this is respected by the PDF export but renders ok in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Paste some tables created in a version of Confluence that supported wiki mark-up or use [Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] to restore the attached storage format. [^storageformat_rowspan]
# Export the page to PDF.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF export should look the same as the Confluence page
h3. Actual Results
The table at the bottom is rendered on top of the larger table above.
h3. Notes
Here is how the page looks in Confluence:
!screenshot.png|thumbnail!
Here is the PDF export:
[^pdf_export_tables.pdf]

h3.Workaround 1
Use the [Source editor plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] to remove the rowspan tags.

h3.Workaround 2
Recreate the tables from scratch.
fields.summary: Tables with rowspan defined render badly in PDF export

fields.description:
The following are the issues that users are facing after inserting the ppt file in a page
1) Numbered lists
Numbered lists in powerpoint appear as bullets and in few slides bullets gone missing when embedded in the page.
2) Font Resizing
Font size is enlarged from original. This causes text to appear in a different location when compared to say a background template image and can cause text to wrap onto multiple lines, when it originally displays within the same line. The text wrapping contributes to the phenomenon where lines of text are cut off and not displayed when the presentation is embedded in the page.
3) Graphic related issues - 3D pictures are not being displayed properly.
4) Colours of diagrams/figures are being changed. 
You can refer the attached ppt in which everything has been explained clearly and also attached the original ppt to reproduce the issue.

1) Name of the attachment which describes the issue: ExamplesOfIncorrectDisplayPPTpreview.pptx

2) Name of the attachment to reproduce the issue: CollaborationStrategy2015.pptx
fields.summary: Formating issues with ppt preview macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41521].
  {panel}

Hi, we have several projects with each their own board. I am working on moving a lot of items from one board to the other. These items all have attachments. After having moved quite a lot of items, I found out I couldn't open the attachments that where attached to the moved items! Among them are images, text files and spreadsheets.

Please don't tell me they are lost forever... That would be a big problem. Hope to hear from you soon.
We are using this version:

 !image-2016-04-26-10-09-25-631.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: (The links to) my attachments are gone after moving to another board

fields.description:
A video is attached showing the bug. Steps to reproduce: * Edit a page in Safari * Find some bold text (was inside a table, not sure if necessary or not) * Hit enter at the end of the text. In some cases, the new paragraph is also bold. * In the case where the new paragraph _is_ bold, insert a bulleted list with the keyboard (Shift+Cmd+B) Expected behaviour: * New bulleted list appears. Doesn't really matter if the content is bold or not. Actual behaviour: * It is not possible to position the cursor in the new list, and cursor jumps down to the following text. The markup created by the editor is {{
}}, with no content inside the {{}} tag. This seems to prevent cursor placement either with the mouse or keyboard. To me this actually looks like two independent bugs: * inline formatting isn't cleared when hitting enter at the end of a paragraph in Safari * when creating a bullet list in an empty paragraph with inline formatting, the inline formatting in the li prevents cursor positioning. I could fix this locally by inserting a non-breaking space into the {{}} element with the inspector.
fields.summary: Creating bullet list with inline formatting prevents cursor positioning in bullet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41519].
  {panel}

We noticed today that a link, where the https:// was mistyped and was missing the final slash, got redirected as if it were a directory on the local web server, instead of just being a broken link.  Would it be better to leave it broken, or to repair the link, instead of prefixing the local server to it?

Steps to reproduce:
1. Edit this page:  https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=72219641
2. Insert a mistyped link:  http:/washington.edu/calendar/trumba
3. Click Save
4. Go visit your link and see where it goes.

Expected:
1. Link would be "fixed" and extra / would be added after the http:/ so the link would go to its intended destination
or
2. Link would go to broken link that I typed in
or
3. I would have been notified after step 2 (or possibly after step 3) that I entered an invalid link

Actual:
https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/ is affixed to the beginning of my link making it:
https://wiki.cac.washington.edu/https:/washington.edu/calendar/trumba
I can understand why the software thought that the "https:/" could have been a directory, but this has been confusing for some of our users.
fields.summary: https:/ is not treated as link prefix

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41518].
  {panel}

I often write processes into confluence. Over time these instructions get replaced. Mostly I just delete the old document when this happens, but sometimes we need to keep two versions alive for a period of time. 

I currently notify users of this scenario using a 'warning' macro.

What I would like is a macro that floats a notification directing the user to the new instructions. I'd like this to stick to the top of the page so it is visible no matter how far down the reader scrolls.

I can do this on a self hosted instance using a user macro and CSS, but I can't do this in the Cloud instance of Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to have a page specific notification panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41515].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-site-152034.html
The above page says that 'Confluence supports importing site and space backups into the same *major* version only' but goes on to describe *minor* version numbers.
Can we please get confirmation for which one is correct?
Are only Minor version numbers supported and 'major' is a typo?
fields.summary: Fix documentation around xml site restoration supported versions
Test vom Mila

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cannot display more than 100 comments on attachment.
h3. Environment
Confluence 5.9.9
PostgreSQL database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add 101 comments to an attachment
# Close the attachment preview
# Preview the attachment again

h3. Expected Results
101 comments would show
h3. Actual Results
Only 100 comments are shown no matter how many more are entered
 
h3. Notes
This query reveals that the comments are being stored in the database, but not displayed:
{code}
select * from CONTENT c1
join CONTENT c2 on c1.CONTENTID = c2.PAGEID
join CONTENTPROPERTIES cp on c2.CONTENTID = cp.CONTENTID
where cp.PROPERTYNAME = 'status'
and c1.CONTENTID = <content ID of attachment>;
{code}

In the query, replace <content ID of attachment> with the ID for the affected attachment. To get the ID:
# preview the attachment by clicking on it on the page
# copy the second number after "preview=/" for example, 557061 in this URL: preview=/98307/557061/1/557081/test.xlsx

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Cannot display more than 100 comments on attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41512].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a User is making page edits across multiple different pages in an instance, they must uncheck 'Notify Watchers' on each page prior to saving/publishing so that they do not notify watchers of changes made.

h3. Suggested Solution
Keep the setting for 'Notify Watchers' across multiple page edits.
 
h3. Workaround 
Uncheck "Notify Watchers" on different page Page Edits before Saving/Publishing changes. 
Or use [Javascript to disable it on every page/space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-uncheck-notify-watchers-check-box-on-confluence-editor-by-default-314449908.html]
fields.summary: Disable Notify Watchers on Subsequent Page Edits After Being Unchecked on Another Page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding Attachments Macro to a page. In IE, the message "Drag and drop to upload or browse for files" is repeated according to the number of Attachments Macro added to the page

\\
h3. Environment
Reproduced on Confluence 5.7, 5.8.18, 5.9.4 and 5.9.8, using IE 11
(!) Issue not reproduced on Chrome or Firefox

\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Page using IE
# Insert a new Attachment Macro to the page
# Insert another Attachment Macro to the page

\\
h3. Expected Results
Two Attachment Macros should be inserted in the page having a single message "Drag and drop to upload or browse for files"

\\
h3. Actual Results
The number of messages per a single Attachment Macro is multiplying depending on the number of Attachment Macros in the page

\\
h3.Workaround
The only workaround available at the moment, is to use Chrome or Firefox
fields.summary: Attachment Macro in IE displays Drag and Drop message multiple times based on the number of Attachment Macros in the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When writing/editing a comment using IE11, the editor loses track of the current line to apply styles such as Lists, Indentation...
(!) This behavior is reproducible 1 out of 3 times on average with IE.
Not reproduced on Chrome or Firefox

\\
h3. Environment
Reproduced with Confluence 5.7, 5.8.10, 5.9.4 and 5.9.8

\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Page in Confluence
# Click into the Comment Field, then the Editor is opened
# Input "Test" and then return with "Enter"
# Input "Test" and then return with "Enter"
# Input "Test" and then return with "Enter"
# Click the "Bullet list" Button.

\\
h3. Expected Results
The 4th line should have the bulleted point

\\
h3. Actual Results
1 out of 3 times, the first line gets the bulleted point instead of the current line.
 
\\
h3.Workaround
The only workaround available at the moment is to use Chrome or Firefox.
fields.summary: Editor in Comment looses track of cursor with IE
X-Accel-Redirect scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-41502].
  {panel}

I want to add my voice to the many others who have expressed a desire to have more fine-grained control over notifications on a per-space (and perhaps per-page too).  This is to support the situation when a private space is set up to contain sensitive information (passwords, private keys, etc.) and we don't want page edits to trigger email containing the sensitive information (as that will open up many more ways in which that info can be sniffed or hacked by 3rd parties).

The ideal solution will implement the same Notification Scheme setup available in JIRA (where each JIRA project can be assigned its own notification scheme... similar, each Confluence space should have the ability to be assigned its own notification scheme also.

Many others have asked for this before:
CONF-174
CONF-29996
CONF-27567
CONF-28326
CONF-30826
CONF-33698
CONF-35985
CONF-41394
CONF-33887

I think this is a basic/fundamental functionality for a wiki software designed to support multiple spaces with different access rights.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Disable notifications per-space (and perhaps per-page too)

fields.description:
The first of two tables can often not be deleted when editing a page with page layouts.

More specifically, the following behavior occurred when reproducing the issue:
* When a layout with several columns is used (2 or 3), the table in a column which has another column to the right cannot be deleted, meaning:
** layout with 2 columns
*** Table in the first (on the left) column cannot be deleted because there's another column on the right
** layout with 3 columns
*** Table in the first (on the left) and second (in the middle) cannot be deleted because each has another column to the right

Please find a gif of the behavior attached.

fields.description:
I have granted viewership and edit permissions to individual and groups on specific pages within our space; however our space generally is restricted to our team. When these individual and groups go to those pages, they cannot edit them. 

This capability is important as _the majority_ of pages are not relevant to be shared immediately with our company as a whole; however when we need to collaborate on a topic or hold a meeting with users, we want to provide transparency. 

It is disruptive to our use of confluence to have to open up the entire site and then lock down subhierarchies simply to ensure that _when_ we want to extend access on a specific page, we can.

It is also not realistic to have a dedicated branch that is public and put all such pages underneath it, because this divorces the pages from the larger topics to which they pertain.

Thanks in advance for addressing this.
fields.summary: Individual Page Permissions fail due to inherited permission

fields.description: I have confluence and jira installed on a server, with connectors set for http and ssl through proxy, and I have an apache server acting as the proxy sending my requests to the appropriate software. Linking the two in this configuration is difficult, but I've got it working for jira by setting the application link as http://localhost:8091/confluence (the http port). When it redirects me to confluence it can't automatically make the link in the opposite direction, but I can form a working link by pointing confluence at http://localhost:9114/jira. The problem comes from confluence's jira integration. Linking a single issue from jira works, but the created jira widget uses the http://localhost:9114/jira address to try to access an image. This causes confluence pages with single jira issue widgets to be marked as insecure, and of course the image will not load because the local user does not have the image file accessible. Can this please be fixed?
fields.summary: Confluence jira integration is using the application url for jira to display the bug type icon.
